function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Viral clumping and associations with suspended proteins may cause variability in viral particle size.","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Adenovirus is the most resistant to 254 nm uv-c and requires high uv doses for complete inactivation.","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Effect of nebulization and liquid impingement on the survival of animal viruses","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Use of aerosol dryer to ensure uniformity of particles","category":"Air","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Effect of relative humidity on uv effectiveness against bacteria and viruses","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Effect of relative humidity on uv susceptibility of viral aerosols","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Viral aerosols exhibit higher uv susceptibility at higher rh.","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Enveloped viruses like mhv coronavirus are susceptible to inactivation by mechanical stress.","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Uv susceptibility of viral aerosols varies with different viruses and rh levels, affecting the effectiveness of uv-c disinfection","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Uv radiation mapping shows variability in uv exposure levels across the chamber.","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Testing the effects of nebulization on the survival of viruses.","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential leakage of viral aerosols due to inadequate sealing of chamber parts.","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Contamination of the experimental chamber by microorganisms due to inadequate filtration or backflow prevention.","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential exposure to viral aerosols during chamber maintenance and growth and spread of airborne pathogens.","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate humidity control in the built environment can promote the growth and spread of airborne pathogens.","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inefficient energy consumption in air conditioning operation can lead to poor indoor air quality and air.","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inaccurate calculation of required power input for uv tubes leading to underperformance or excessive energy consumption.","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate design of the uv-c system leading to high operating seasons.","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Contamination of air conditioning ducts with dust and mold due to environmental conditions.","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Electrical breakdowns caused by high humidity and condensation affecting fluorescent lamps.","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Fluorescent lamp efficiency falling below 70% in uv-c range at low temperatures and airflow.","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Shortened life cycle of fluorescent lamps due to excessive switching
